title: Kargil martyr’s daughter files threat complaint; ABVP student alleges molestation | delhi | Hindustan Times
text:
Kargil martyr’s daughter files threat complaint; ABVP student alleges molestation delhi Updated: Feb 27, 2017 15:08 IST Shradha Chettri Hindustan Times Members of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) shout slogans during a protest march at the Delhi University on February 23. (AFP) 
Gurmehar Kaur, the daughter of a Kargil martyr, filed a complaint with the Delhi Commission of Women (DCW) on Monday after she allegedly received “rape threats” for her social media campaign against the ABVP . Senior Delhi Police officers said on Monday that Kaur had not approached the police so far, but assured action if she decided to take the legal route. 
Meanwhile, a Delhi University student and activist of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) filed a complaint with the police alleging that she was molested by two student activists of the All India Student Association (AISA) on February 21. The ABVP student claimed that the incident took place outside Shri Ram College of Commerce (SRCC) on the day when the literary fest at Ramjas college was cancelled. Violent protests had broken out following the cancellation of the event with ABVP on one side and Left Wing student organisations along with students from different DU colleges on the other side. Read more Delhi Police: Will take action if Kargil martyr’s daughter files rape threat FIR 
The police said that they have received a complaint in the matter but have not registered a separate FIR. The matter has been put as a complaint under the common FIR lodged for events of February 22 Pictures and videos of female students scuffling and fighting on February 22 had surfaced across media at that time. “This is a completely false propaganda by the ABVP. There is no evidence of such a thing,” said Aman Awaz, DU AISA leader. tags
